    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Eloko</h1>If a biloko is lucky enough to consume several spellcasters or other creatures with innate magical abilities, it undergoes a subtle transformation over the course of 1 week. Such a fey is known as an eloko, and in addition to their incredible appetite (even by biloko standards), they have the supernatural ability to grow to immense size.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fey</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 23<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=443">Eloko</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 7</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\BilokoEloko.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\BilokoEloko.png"></a><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Small" class="traitsize" title="Small">Small</span><span alt="Fey Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures of the First World are called the fey."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">Fey</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01znt?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-146-Cult-of-Cinders" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #146: Cult of Cinders pg. 83</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +15; low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=13"><u>Aklo</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=39"><u>Mwangi</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=10"><u>Sylvan</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +18, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10"><u>Nature</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +16, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=16"><u>Survival</a></u> +13<br /><b>Str</b> +6, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> +0, <b>Wis</b> +4, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=66"><u>blowgun (10 poisoned darts)</u></a>, <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Weapons.aspx?ID=3">+1 dagger</i></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 25, <b>Fort</b> +12, <b>Ref</b> +18, <b>Will</b> +15<br /><b>HP</b> 115<hr /><b>Speed</b> 20 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> jaws +17, <b>Damage</b> 2d8+8 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>dagger</i> +18 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile S</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d4+8 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> blowgun +17 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=188"><u>nonlethal</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 20 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=254"><u>reload 1</a></u>), <b>Effect</b> 1 piercing plus 2d4 persistent poison</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> <i>dagger</i> +18 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=195"><u>thrown 10 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile S</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d4+8 piercing</span><b>Primal Innate Spells</b> DC 22; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=34">charm</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Inspired Feast</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=60"><u>emotion</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>) If a biloko feasts on a human corpse for 1 minute or more, they gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 hour.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Size Alteration</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=127"><u>polymorph</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=134"><u>primal</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) The eloko is affected by a 4th-level <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=102">enlarge</a></i> spell. This lasts for 1 minute, and the eloko can Dismiss the Spell.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Sneak Attack</b> The eloko deals 2d6 extra precision damage to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=16">flat-footed</a> creatures.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=108">Biloko</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=442">Biloko Veteran</a></td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=441">Biloko Warrior</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=443">Eloko</a></td><td>7</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=108">Biloko</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01znt?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-146-Cult-of-Cinders" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #146: Cult of Cinders pg. 82</i></a><br />Bilokos are crocodile-snouted fey who stalk the Mwangi Jungle and feast upon the flesh of humans. As cunning as they are vicious, bilokos employ deadly traps and guerilla hunting tactics to capture prey—typically hapless explorers or occasionally wayward villagers who believe bilokos to be cruel ancestral spirits. The most powerful of these creatures, known as elokos, wield potent transformative magic.<br /><br /> A biloko looks like a slender but wiry humanoid with a head resembling a crocodile’s, rust-colored skin, and blood-red eyes. It eats only the meat of humanoids, though it can survive for extended periods of time on a single meal thanks to its snake-like ability to consume a typical Medium humanoid creature whole, which it does by unhinging its jaws and slowly swallowing the victim from head to foot. Thanks to its acidic saliva and sharp teeth, a biloko can masticate its food into an easy-to-digest pulp, grinding flesh and bone into a compact mush, even while swallowing, and does not flinch while devouring meals two or three times its own size. A biloko that has recently fed is easily recognizable by its distended belly, though the fey is no less dangerous then, as it delights in killing and might have hungry comrades hiding among nearby.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Charming Predators</h3>Bilokos’ connection to the First World grants them a limited ability to supernaturally charm their enemies. Bilokos use this power to lure stragglers away from their adventuring parties or confuse their opponents when a raid goes horribly awry. Large hunting parties of bilokos might charm entire groups of travelers, in which case these bilokos might bring their enchanted quarry back to their tribe to feast on (though they are more likely to simply enjoy the spoils of their efforts alone).<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Guerilla Ambushers</h3>Bilokos prefer to move about in small, stealthy packs in dark, isolated sections of the jungle. When a band of bilokos finds a suitable hunting ground, it claims the area exclusively, digging pit traps, crafting snares from vines, and building blinds high in trees where the predators can lie in ambush.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> The Biloko City</h3>In the jungles north of Lake Ocota, rumors speak of an incredibly powerful eloko who calls himself Emperor Sharptooth and rules over an entire city of bilokos and other fey. While such coordination between the capricious fey is not unheard of, explorers have been unable to verify these stories, as all who attempt to find the biloko settlement are never seen again. Recently, a group of Pathfinders based out of Nantambu has started collecting funds for an expedition to find this mysterious city and return with information (and possibly a wealth of treasure).</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
